definitions.definition: A particularly difficult question or puzzle .
Someone who asks a question or sets a problem.
examples: Even as a child, she was a habitual poser of difficult questions.

definitions.definition: Someone who, or something which, poses ; a person who sets their body in a fixed position, such as for photography or painting.
A poseur ; someone who affects some behaviour , style, attitude or other condition, often to impress or influence others.

main_definition: ( British ) A particularly difficult question or puzzle .
secondary_definitions: Someone who asks a question or sets a problem.
Someone who, or something which, poses ; a person who sets their body in a fixed position, such as for photography or painting.
( derogatory , slang ) A poseur ; someone who affects some behaviour , style, attitude or other condition, often to impress or influence others.
